cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the western Florida Panhandle, then forecast to arc north-northeast inland across Alabama, Georgia, and the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City-Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning: Indian Pass FL to Yankeetown FL; Tropical Storm Warning: Navarre FL to Wakulla/Jefferson County line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, then inland across southeast AL, GA, and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are not expected to reach northwest Ohio; only breezy conditions possible as remnants pass far to the southeast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None â€“ Toledo is a Great Lakes port, surge from Fred will be confined to the Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1-2 inches of rain mid-week, but widespread flooding is not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential for minor river/stream rises from mid-week rainfall; otherwise no significant tropical hazards expected.
